> in Java
> everything that's public is published, whether you want it to b=
e or
> not. 

That's not true. Even in Sun's libraries, there are public cl=
asses and
methods in com.sun packages, which per convention aren't *publish=
ed*. If you
use them, you do so at your own peril.

You simply have to find=
 conventions other than being public to mark
published API. In the project =
I'm currently working on, that wouldn't
suffice anyway, because we publish =
different APIs to different customers,
for example.

Cheers, Ilja
